Hi all,

If you're not familiar with ExtraVM and are looking for a VPS or migrating from elsewhere, maybe this thread will interest you. ExtraVM has SSD / NVMe VPS in half a dozen locations around the world, and since day 1 uptime and reliability has been the first priority. ExtraVM was started in early 2014 with a single location offering VPS in Dallas. Since then, things have expanded from VPS in one location to 6 locations for VPS while offering things like cPanel web hosting and game servers in many more. You can trust that your data will be safe and secure, and enjoy transparency with any potential scheduled maintenance, network, or hardware issues.

Check out the hardware used in each location.
* Dallas, Texas, USA - Ryzen 3900X or 3950X, NVMe SSD _(10G Best Effort Protection)_
* Vint Hill, Virginia, USA - Ryzen 3800X, NVMe SSD _(Unlimited DDoS Protection, via OVH)_
* Beauharnois/Montreal, Canada - Ryzen 3800X, NVMe SSD _(Unlimited DDoS Protection, via OVH)_
* Beaumarchais/Montreal, Canada - E-2136, NVMe SSD _(these will be migrated to Ryzen in the future) (Unlimited DDoS Protection, via OVH)_
* London, United Kingdom - Ryzen 3800X, NVMe SSD _(Unlimited DDoS Protection, via OVH)_
* Strasbourg, France - Ryzen 3800X, NVMe SSD _(Unlimited DDoS Protection, via OVH)_
* Gravelines, France - E-2136, NVMe SSD _(these will be migrated to Ryzen in the future) (Unlimited DDoS Protection, via OVH)_
* Singapore. Asia - i7-6700K & E3-1245v5, SSD & NVMe Mix _(Unlimited DDoS Protection, via OVH)_
* Sydney, Australia - E3-1245v5, SSD _(Unlimited DDoS Protection, via OVH)_
* Moscow, Russia - Ryzen 3700X, NVMe _(NO DDoS Protection)_

Have a question? Send an email to sales {at} extravm.com, get a quick answer.

**Full and updated hardware list for all services**
Any future hardware changes or additions are updated on our [hardware support page](https://extravm.com/billing/knowledgebase/31/What-hardware-do-you-use.html "hardware support page"), where you can find a list of all current hardware in use for every service and location.

**Looking Glass (Test IP)**
You can use the looking glass servers to check latency and routing, click the drop down box on the page to go to other locations. Looking glass servers aren't available for all locations yet.
